section.title:
list pricing schedules
master list of List Pricing Schedules
section.para: A list pricing schedule is used to modify the standard list price for an item, creating an alternate list price. List pricing schedules may be assigned to individual customers or to groups of customers by customer type. To learn more about how alternate list pricing works, please see the Alternate List Pricing article at xTupleU.
To access the master list of list pricing schedules, select the List Pricing Schedules option. The following screen will appear:

At the top of the screen is a Search for field. To search for a list pricing schedule, begin typing in the search field. As you type, the list will automatically scroll toward the list pricing schedule you are typing. You can also search for list pricing schedules manually by scrolling through the list. note.para: The effectivity and expiration dates for list pricing schedules correspond to the created date for sales orders. Changes to line item quantities or scheduled dates for already-created sales orders can also cause list pricing schedule effectivity to be recalculated as of the date the changes occur.
